Container.Name: i2p
Container.Overview:
I2P (Invisible Internet Project) is an anonymous network layer that allows for censorship-resistant, peer-to-peer communication. Access .i2p websites, communicate anonymously, and browse the hidden internet through this decentralized network.
After installation, access the router console at http://:7657 to configure your router. Configure your browser to use HTTP proxy :4444 for browsing .i2p sites. Allow 15-30 minutes for the router to integrate into the I2P network.

Config.Name: Router Console
Config.Description: Port for I2P Router Console web interface. Access your router configuration, monitoring, and tunnel management at http://[IP]:7657

Config.Name: HTTP Proxy
Config.Description: HTTP proxy port for browsing .i2p websites. Configure your browser to use [IP]:4444 as HTTP proxy to access hidden I2P sites

Config.Name: HTTPS Proxy
Config.Description: HTTPS proxy port for secure I2P browsing. Configure your browser to use [IP]:4445 as HTTPS proxy for encrypted .i2p site access

Config.Name: IRC Proxy
Config.Description: IRC proxy for accessing I2P IRC networks. Configure your IRC client to connect through [IP]:6668 to reach Irc2P servers

Config.Name: I2P Data
Config.Description: Persistent storage for I2P configuration, router info, tunnel settings, and application data

Config.Name: I2PSnark Downloads
Config.Description: Download directory for I2PSnark torrents. Change this path to your preferred download location

Config.Name: Monotone Proxy
Config.Description: Monotone proxy port for distributed version control over I2P. Used for secure code repository access through the I2P network
